title: Perform a Pre-Flight Walk-around Inspection
description: Before every flight, a pilot must perform a walk-around inspection of the aircraft to check for any obvious issues.

tasks.description: Follow a standard checklist to visually inspect the aircraft's exterior.
tasks.expected_outcome: Pilot follows the prescribed flow around the aircraft.

tasks.description: Check for issues such as tire condition, leaks, damage to control surfaces, and that all sensor covers have been removed.
tasks.expected_outcome: Pilot carefully inspects all key areas.

tasks.description: If any issues are found, report them to maintenance. If not, sign off on the inspection in the aircraft's technical log.
tasks.expected_outcome: No issues are found. Pilot signs the log, confirming the aircraft is fit to fly.
